Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Simon B
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Pergolese is a good hotel not far from the Arc de Triomphe - located at the top of the Champs Elysee. This hotel is good value, especially in the high cost Paris market. The staff made me feel welcome and the free internet was a bonus. They spoke great English and were quick to help me find some local restaurants to eat at. The hotel is located near the Argentine metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for The Palais de Congres”
Reviews.Author: Richard W
Reviews.Content: One of the best located and value for money hotels I have stayed in when working at the Palais de Congres. Staff were helpful and friendly. Room larger than usual for Paris hotel. Breakfast absolutely great for a quick bite and get away. Also very close to Arc de Triomphe etc. Will use again if available.

Reviews.Title: “very good place if you have a congress at le palais de congess”
Reviews.Author: pecinha
Reviews.Content: very good hotel, very well runned, quiet, concierge very polite and atentive, 2 bloks from palais de congress, very close to arch triunf and champs elisse. best place to stay if you need to go to palais de congress

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: AmarillaArvika
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel within walking distance of Champs Elysees and all the sights, close to metro station with easy transport to and from airport Charles de Gaulle. We arrived late without having booked in advance, but were lucky enough to get the last room of the day at a very good price. Service very good and room very clean with all the little extras that you would expect from a hotel in this price range. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location was great with only a 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe. My room was quite small but well equipped with a mini bar and towelling robes included with the standard room. Buffet Breakfast was worth the price. Wi-fi worked fine. No noise. No free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tinuks
Reviews.Content: TI arrived at the hotel really tired almost in the middle of the night and was pleased to be checked in within 5 minutes. The receptionist was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was fairly big for a Paris hotel and the bathroom was quite nice as well. The location is great. A few minutes walk from the avenue Champs Elysses and excellent for a shopping trip. There are also a few Metro stations close by. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly atmosphere, good location”
Reviews.Author: Chimemark
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly good hotel for Paris and in a great location not far from the Congress center, Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. Rooms are a good size with a decent shower (very important). The only downside is I paid 240 euro for 1 night! I only booked the night before, so make sure you book early.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & Central”
Reviews.Author: AMK1981
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend stay here in November, lovely little hotel, very basic reception area, rooms are a bit compact, but the beds are super comfortable, and the pillows are the most comfortable i have ever slept on. This is not a very modern hotel, but it is very comfy. Bathrobes are provided also, and there was a bath and shower in the bathroom, shower was very good. Rooms were very warm. Mini bar also in room, but very expensive. Staff were very accommodating, we arrived off a very early flight so were at the hotel for about 11.30am and we were able to get into our room straight away so that was brilliant. This hotel is in a great location, 20 min walk to the Eiffel Tower, 10 mins from the Arc D’Triumph, and 5 min walk to the nearest metro to take you anywhere you want to go. Also lots of restaurants nearby and a delicious boulangerie right on the doorstep. Would recommend this hotel for its comfort and excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ICMesquita
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located near metro and walking distance from Champs Elysees , is very quiet , clean and suits the classification of 4 star . Internet free in the rooms , nice and simple continental and buffet breakfast , confortable beds and most of all very nice attendants in the reception .

Reviews.Title: “stayed in july”
Reviews.Author: j j
Reviews.Content: obviously as it was july the hotel was very busy so 2 couple who tried to check in after us did not get the room even tho they did have a booking... the hotel was ok, breakfast in bed was very poor for £15.00per person we only got croissant and orange juice even tho teh receptionist promised we would get fruit and yoghurt as well... 3 times chambermaids were trying to get into our room before 11am and whats worst even tho we asked them to stay away teh 4th time she walked on my using a bathroom.... would not recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Right at home!”
Reviews.Author: Maculate
Reviews.Content: The rooms are cosy and well equipped with flat screen tv and radio. Kettle is also provided for us to boil our own water. Despite it's small room size, it's comfortable and it feels right at home. Most impressive are the friendliness of all the hotel receptionists! They were always helpful and are able to communicate well in English.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff was wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: NoBreakfast
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very courteous, helpful and friendly. The only issue we had was with Delta Vacations they advertised free breakfast but didn't follow through to provide the hotel with the required informant so we could get our free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spa67
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pergolese was a great hotel. The staff was excellent! They suggested great restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, Good places to shop, and gave us directions to anywhere we wanted to go. When we arrived our rooms were not ready however the staff brought out pastries, tea and coffee for us until it was time to check in. The rooms were a very good size by Paris standards. The beds were very comfortable and it was very quiet at night. The only issue we had was our travel agency advertised that this hotel had free breakfast. Well it does not. Otherwise it is a hotel that I would recommend and visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden gem in the 16th”
Reviews.Author: Pathcat
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Argentine metro station on the Boulevard Grandes Armees and also close to Porte Maillot which is an Air France Bus stop from CDG and also where the shuttle buses to Beauvais Airport (Ryanair flights) depart and arrive. Very pleasant and helpful staff - Cyril was a gem! Stayed in a double room for single use; I believe it was #47. Room is of a good size for the price and Paris in general. Amenities are on par with a good 4-star hotel - minibar, bathrobe, roomsafe, tea and coffee facilities, etc. Very comfortable stay; will not hesitate to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Likely best small hotel I had since I can remember”
Reviews.Author: Outlander-pro
Reviews.Content: We had an outstanding experience in this hotel. The staff was so friendly that we felt like visiting close family or friends (Aurora, -if I remember her name correctly- was above all expectations). The room was impeccable, very well designed in a modern fashion, of good size (in Paris terms) and equipped with all the facilities that you would expect from a first class hotel. The public areas of the hotel were also very nice and warm but small in proportions. The location is very good, more or less 500-600 meters or 1 metro stop from el Arc de Triomphe. On the less bright sides: there is no Gym in the hotel; the breakfast buffet could have had larger variety and choices for the price (or the price lower), but at least my double espresso + croissants were terrific. These 2 issues do not cause us to reduce the 5 rating we give to this property based on our overall experience and feelings. In any case you can take a nice French breakfast for better price in one of several nearby patisseries/ boulangeries/ cafes (unless you want eggs) and you are going to walk/run/bike all day long in Paris anyway so who needs a gym after all?

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, Comfortable but away from the core of Paris”
Reviews.Author: FtMacTompkins
Reviews.Content: We were only able to stay in Paris for a day and a half, and spent 2 nights here at the hotel. When I made the booking, I was quite pleased with the price I was paying, The Clerk that checked us in, made a "bad joke" about it being the "honeymoon suite", I thought that this was odd but when i saw the room, i understood. It was located on the very top floor of the hotel, in the corner so the ceiling was quite low and slanted, and the room quite small, good thing that we are short. The bathroom was huge and there were bathrobes for the guest to use. It was however, I little ackward to take a shower. You had to hold the shower head. Warning about the elevator. It only holds 4 people and even at that, it is tight. As soon as the elevator doors open, and you step out, there is the staircase with no protective railing. If you have heavy, or ackward bags this may be something to watch out for. The Internet service was a paid one. I know i paid cash for 3 tickets and charged a 4th one to my room. When I went to check out and was reviewing my bill, the girl at the front desk actually Charged my room for those three internet tickets. I was able to dispute them with the night Auditor and after 10 mins, he reversed the charges. Breakfast was NOT included in the room rate. and even though it was a little expensive, it was worth it. This Hotel is located only 2 blocks from the L'Arc de Triomeph. It was an awesome walk and we found some good restaurants in the area. It also was not far from the Hop On, Hop Off bus locations which was very convenient to get into the heart of Paris This hotel was clean and comfortable. The bed was OK we again had sore backs but the pillows were really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Spiroo974
Reviews.Content: Very nice hosts, nicely redocareted, rooms are fine and hotel close to the Arc de Triomphe / Champs Elysées. Perfect for a week end or even longer stays in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Barnagirl
Reviews.Content: Arrived to Paris to spend only one night, booked a single room and when I arrived I've got an upgrade to the suite...I had a very pleasant stay, location was great and the stuff is very friendly. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: Liany
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the HOtel Pergolese in Paris where I stayed last month. The location is ideal, 10mn walking distance from the Champs Elysees, with plenty of good restaurants around, and a tube station close by, ideal to discover Paris. The room are quite large by Paris standard, and the staff very helpful. The breakfast buffet is amazing as well.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, great staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: carstef
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, whilst our room was small it was not tiny , the bathroom was great. We arrived in Paris when it was cold and snowy and the room was warm and after a day of walking around the city in the snow the hot bath was magic and a definate bonus. It was close to the metro and the food options in the area were good. The staff were so helpful and polite, one of the reasons i chose the hotel in the firstplace was a review that said the staff were good. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimNorthants
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights and found the hotel very clean and comfortable. The location is good being just a short walk from the Arc de triumph but in a quiet area. The staff in the hotel were very helpful. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Andre79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 500 m from the Arc de Triomphe and even less from the Congress Center, close to a metro station. It is very small, arranged in an old building with narrow hallways and rather small rooms but this gives it an intimate and cosy atmosphere. Nicely decorated, good breakfast, very convenient tea and coffee arrangements in the room. Extra thanks to the staff, very helpful, polite and all very good English speakers.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice of hotel for a family break in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: w-spoons
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights (2 adults, children 13 & 11) mid august booking a family room with breakfast direct with the hotel. Hotel location is very good, a bit less hectic than staying in the touristy areas, felt safe. 2 minutes to Argentine metro but we tended to use Charles de Gaulle Etoile (Arc de Triomphe) station a 5 minutes walk away giving access to the metro or RER-A. RER-A took 2 stops to the Louvre and ran direct to Disneyland Paris (well worth visiting even just for a day, tiring). We travelled from CDG airport taking about 1 hour using RER-B & RER-A. There are a handful of restaurants close by, French one on the same street as the hotel and an Italian at the far end of the street. There is a shop (drinks, snacks, fruit etc) open till after midnight near the Argentine metro entrance. Hotel reception staff where very welcoming and helpful and all spoke English. Had some difficulty conversing with the breakfast staff. Family room was the main reason for booking this hotel and we where not disappointed. Two good size rooms with a private hall between, one double room and one twin room each room having its own bathroom, air conditioning, tea/coffee tray, television & free safe. It was much better than all being squashed together in one quad room. Rooms where spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Very good selection for breakfast, as well as continental choice we where surprised to find sausage, scrambled egg and bacon (if you where lucky). Only had bacon one day as it kept running out. Breakfast organisation was a bit chaotic, but we always left well fed. Highly recommend the hotel Pergolese especially for the reception staff, cleanliness and family room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: wherenext_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and greatly enjoyed it! The room was very clean and had all the necessities but a bit small. Staff was incredibly helpful and even booked a last minute tour for us. We took the AirFrance shuttle from CDG airport and it was quick and affordable, dropping us off about a 5minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service but not a central location”
Reviews.Author: DavenOris
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay here for 5 nights. Room was pretty standard for Europe, small room, small bathroom but very nice and clean. The staff was very helpful. Lots of cafes around, some very good. Very close to the Metro. I would have liked to be a little more centrally located. The hotel was in a very nice area but a little bit out of the way from central Paris. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience - strongly advise.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoFamily2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed for several nights in the family suite which is basically a lock-out type of room where you have two separate rooms - one king room and one room with 2 twin beds. This hotel was very well run with helpful, friendly and professional staff. All the staff spoke English very well, which was nice for us. The hotel is very clean and safe. Staff helped us book meals at other locations and had our ride to the airport ready on time. We really liked the location. It is only a couple hundred yards to the Arc and more tourist area, but is in a quite location. Many nice cafes within a couple blocks that we enjoyed for good meals and wine at a reasonable price (for Paris). The rooms are a good size and the bathrooms are very roomy and good (particularly for Paris). For families (we have young and teenagers) or couples this seems like a real winner. We also saw business people at the hotel and all visitors and staff seemed happy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: IsraelSue1971
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from this hotel and felt compelled to write a review. This is a great hotel. Our room was a bit small but very well appointed. Comfortable bed, TV, tea and coffee making facilities, good-sized closet, smallish bathroom but had everything required. This hotel has the nicest staff ever - very helpful, polite, gave recommendations upon request for restaurants, taxis etc. There are lots of bakeries and cafes in the area. We didn't take the breakfast and for around 7 euros per person you can have a continental breakfast at one of several places within 2 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Zombie79
Reviews.Content: I'm looking forward to staying here again. The hotel was a short walk from the metro line and the Arc de Triomphe. The room was well appointed, clean and offered an enjoyable bath. Great dining also found a short distance from the hotel, but this is Paris - great dining is everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and classy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nanamei
Reviews.Content: The service was of high quality. The staff was friendly and helpful. They even lend us an umbrella when it was raining.The room was beautiful and the location perfect to go by foot at the conference! I recommend it to any type of travelers who look for a high standard hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Want to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Shoppingqueen1989
Reviews.Content: Me & my boyfriend stayed here for 3 nights back in December 2007 - from Friday 12th- Monday 15th. Upon arrival (which took us approx 20 minutes by taxi from Gare Du Nord), we were greeted by two very friendly staff members who checked us in & took our bags up to our room. While they done this we waited in the reception area which was very warm & cozy. As it was around 8pm on our arrival, we were very hungry & they were more than helpful in guiding us to McDonalds, which is about a 10minute walk from the hotel. We were in room 55 - which if I remember is on the 5th floor. We didn't have a fantastic view out of our window - but it didn't put us off. The rooms are of a lovely size - we had a double room which featured a Bose TV with pay to view tv, Bose Phone, VERY comfy double bed, double wardrobe with safe, ironing board and iron and also a very reasonably sized bathroom - very big bath, hot water, robes & complimentary toiletries. Throughout our visit we came along many little treasures - On walking to McDonalds, you can find a lovely little pizza shop which offer eat in or takeaway options (we had this on the 2nd day & it was amazing!!), a bakery (2minutes around the corner from the hotel - offering croissants of every variety, baguettes, sandwiches, cakes, etc), a small grocers (offering drinks, food, etc) & also a sweet shop. Both located within 5 minutes walking distance. Moving along, down the Champs Elysees there are many restaurants from Indian, Chinese, Thai, Mexican, and of course French Cusine - one place I would recommend is the Pizza restaurant which is near to the Louis Vuitton store - for a 14"Pizza, Fries & 2 drinks it cost appoximately £15, which is very good for Paris. Nearer to the Notre Dame, you can find many bakeries and restaurants, but here they are slightly more expensive. Attractions & Things to Do The 'La Defense Arch' is to the left as you walk out of the hotel street - approximately a 20minute walk. As you turn right out of the street, you can walk to the Arc de Triomphe (5minutes) - the best time of day to go up is about 6pm as it is alot less busy & is slightly cheaper - you get some amazing views. Other places, I would recommend are The Louvre (you need a day here), Musee d'Orsay, Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower, Moulin Rouge, Sacre Coeur & Monmarte and also a boat tor of the Seine - this is were you get the best views of Paris & not only that you can buy 'Boat-Bus' passes which are valid from half a day up to 7 days. These stop at all the attractions I have listed above & more. Also, very cheap!! Traveling Around The best way to travel is by foot if you have the energy - we saw some amazing views by doing this & saved a bit of money. For these who arent so keen on doing this, I would deffinitely recommend the Metro - very easy to use (just like the London Underground) and once you have used once, it is very simple. Free Metro maps are available at each stop. This is a very cheap way of travelling around & also stops at the main attactions. One thing which I have to say is a negative about Paris & I'm sure other people who have visited would agree is that you have to be very aware of Con-Artists & Pick Pockets, especially around the attractions - our main one was the Eiffel Tower. Some woman followed me into the toilets & tried to get money off me, thankfully there were guards around & told her to go away. Just please be very cautious!! Overall, I would agree with what everyone says - this is the City of Love & I am planning another trip here next year!! I can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, cosy”
Reviews.Author: Burgeoning_traveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the hotel in August, from the 20th to the 22nd. The hotel is small and tucked away in a little corner. The elevator and stairwell is tiny. But the room we had was a decent sized space, surprising for paris. Julia, one of the owners, was so lovely and hospitable. She helped us find our way and suggested places we should see. Because this hotel is family owned, you do get that individual attention, which is a nice feeling. The metro and RER stations were close by, and a short walk away was the magnificent Arc de Triompfe and the Champs de Elysees shopping district. There were a number of cafe's in the area, which were really lovely. With the friendly atmosphere, I am sure we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Cosy and good value”
Reviews.Author: IdRatherBeAtHome
Reviews.Content: I found the Best Western Premier Pergolèse on the web in close proximty to where I was required to hold my meeting at the St James Hotel (450 Euro a night). I needed an alternative place to stay over, and the Pergolèse did not disappoint. The room was as roomy as youd expect for paris, and modern, with good room facilities. The Breakfast was ok, but not worth 17 Euro. Upon request, reception recommended me a a good French cuisine restaurant L'Aubege Dab at 161 Avenue Malakoff (500m walk) which did not disappoint (http://www.gerard-joulie.com/aubergedab-1.html) I only had one issue in that reception is attended to by only one person. I waited for close to 15 minutes whilst another annoying guest asked every conceivable question under the sun and sucked the hotel staff dry. When I got served it took less than 1 minute to get my keys and checkin. Not a big issue, but after a hideous days travel I would have liked to get to my room as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would reccomend to everyone!”
Reviews.Author: zajda2009
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in that hotel for two nights. It was big pleasure to stay in this hotel. Room was not very spacious, but big enough. Great comfortable bed (queen bed), big bathroom, lot of towels, great bathrobes. Everything was clean and tidied. Big advantage is free wireless internet in rooms. The hotel is also good located - only a few minutes from metro station, Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Elyssees boulevard. Staff was very friendly, receptionist helped us and gave us nice tips where to go and what to see. There was nothing to complain about and we would choose this hotel again without doubts.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed at in Europe...period!”
Reviews.Author: VonWandurer
Reviews.Content: I have travelled around the world and stayed in all kinds of hotels. While I'm American, I was born in Europe and have lived here on and off for almost a decade. This is the the best overall hotel I've stayed in. We had two connected rooms (for my kids) and it was great. Roomy (by European stds), clean, warm (during a cold Christmas), and no mold. I read the review saying it's on a scary street...well, not really. It is one street in from the Champs, but the street bisects the Champs at a 45 degree angle; the hotel is about 15-20 feet from the angle itself. So, it could be on a bad street, except the bad part would be about 200-300 yards from the hotel and the Champs. At the angle you have a bakery, cafes, an authentic sushi restaurant (lived 6 years in Japan), and the hotel. On Christmas, we walked from the hotel, onto Champs, one block to Arch de Triumph, and all the way to Louvre. Lovely long walk and quite safe. Very nice staff: receptionist greeted us every morning, porter gave lots of tips, and maid service actually cleaned. Don't know about restaurant though. Spent 2 weeks all over France for Christmas and this was the best of all of our 4 & 5 star hotels. Highly recommend, but it ain't cheap.

Reviews.Title: “total dump”
Reviews.Author: fedupIreland
Reviews.Content: It was a nightmare.We had a horrible little room looking over sheds over grown folliage.Booked superior room ,on arrival told we didnt and had to pay 100 euro for upgrade all i can say is judging by state of room I would not like to see basic room.Where hotel is situated is a rough looking street.It was scary left early and flew home to Ireland.We are a couple in our forties and I never stayed in such a dump.Take my advice look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fightingfit
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel and absolutely loved it. Superb location, just 7 minutes walk from Arc de Triomphe and 2 minute walk to Argentine metro stop. The Air France bus from CDG also stops near the Arc de Triomphe or Port Maillot so is perfect for getting to the hotel. It costs 22 euros return each which is much cheaper than a taxi. You'll need to make your way to Terminal 1 or 2 on the airport shuttle at CDG though, but its easy enough. We just asked someone then where the buses went from. You'll need to get on bus route 2. The hotel is in a lovely side street off Avenue de la grande armée. At the top of this street is a patisserie which sells amazing croissants and cakes. We got these for breakfast rather than pay 18 euros for the hotel breakfast. The hotel itself is lovely and clean and has a lot of character, not just a standard Best Western Hotel. The staff were friendly enough, not rude but not over friendly either. The rooms were quite big for a big city hotel. There was a small sitting area and a large wardrobe with a safe. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and would stay here again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: waj50
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights, 14th/15th April 2008, i booked it for our anniversary. We got the Air France shuttle from the airport, they run every 15 mins 13 euros each one way...much cheaper than a cab! Our stop was the first one, at Porte Maillot. The hotel is down the street called Rue Pergolese on the right hand side. Being honest, i did ask someone which street it was and they pointed it out and that was it. But if you have never been before how you going to know? We arrived well before the room was available(2.00pm) and the reception staff were brilliant. They took our bags and suggested we go and do a bit of sightseeing as the room would be ready in an hour. They explained where the nearest Metro station was(5 mins) but if we wanted, then the Champs Elysees was back up the street just the other side of the Arc De Triomphe. All this was in walking distance of the Hotel. The main street off Rue Pergolese was called Avenue De La Grande Armee and once there you can actualy see the A D T. There are lots of little cafe's, restaraunts and shops but its probably best to walk down the Ch.Elysees. The Hotel breakfast was quite expensive, both in the room or in the restaraunt, so we ate out on both mornings just at the end of the street. As in most Hotels the mini-bar is also well over the top, but we still had a Brandy at the end of our day!!! The room was quite small, as they all are in France but it was tastefully decorated and the bathroom was immaculate and included nice toiletries along with fluffy bathrobes. They even had a Bang and Oleffson tv!!!! All in all you dont do Paris on a budget so be prepared to spend. The best was to get about is the Metro without a doubt, we bought 10 tickets for 11 euros and it got us all over the place. We would use this hotel again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “rude and complacent”
Reviews.Author: hoppalongkate
Reviews.Content: even by paris standards the complacency of this hotel and its booking/reception staff are stunning. Apparently it was great years ago - So what. Overpriced, pokey. not in a great street. Its a petty great western chain put up with rude staff like that, I used to like staying in their hotels, and stayed in the victor hugo last year whose staff couldnt have been more helpful but now i have lost trust in the brand completely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londonwithbaby
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Best Western Pergolese hotel during the weekend of the 2008 Paris Marathon with my wife and my 8 month old baby. It was a great hotel!. I have been to Paris many times and this hotel ranks highest in my list for the price. Location: 2 streets from the Arc de triompe, 2 blocks away from many restaurants and withing walking distance from the Eiffel Tower. Staff: Very helpful and very friendly. I booked the hotel using their website so I had no problems at all upon arrival. Facilities: I ordered a crib (baby bed) before arrival and it was waiting in our room. At breakfast the hotel has a baby high chair and an elevator to get you to your floor. Our room was spacious (for continental hotels' standards) and incredibly quiet. My fried who travelled with 2 toddlers (3 and 7 yr old) was booked in semi-private area of the hotel and he mentioned it was also very quiet and spacious. I was expecting that the Paris Marathon would create issues with our acomodation but I was very pleasently surprised by the high quality of our room, hotel staff and location that I certainly recomend small families to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emolloy
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of december. The hotel is so easy to find - it is only a 5 minute walk from where the Airport bus (Beauvais) drops you in the city centre. We arrived at about 11pm and found the area very safe to walk around. We were greeted at the hotel by a really nice male receptionist who told us about the hotel facilities and advised us where we could go for something to eat in the area that night as we hadnt eaten in a few hours. He also advised us about the morning breakfast and told us we could call him at any time during the night as he "doesnt sleep"!!!! We had booked a superior room in the hotel pergolese, when we arrived in our room, I was initially disappointed at the size of the room, but then discovered the large wardrobe space that we had out in the hallway of the bedroom just inside the door. We had satellite tv and the bathroom was really big with power shower and very clean toilet, sink and bath area. Overall, the hotel was spotless. the only complaint I have about the hotel is the breakfast - the waitresses did not have much english (not their fault I suppose as they are french!!) and the breakfast was very limited. Only juices, croissants, bread and cheese, small amount of cereals. there were no omlettes or boiled eggs at all. (these were on the room service menu for breakfast but not available in the restaurant?) The hotel is only about 6 or 7 minute walk from the arc de triomphe at the top of the champs elyssee. and there is the yellow line metro about 2 minutes walk from the front door of the hotel which took us directly to the main shopping area and the galeries lafayette. the location of the hotel is just perfect as it is on a small quiet street just off the avenue de la grand armee. It is very quiet at night time and the windows have great sound proofing!! Overall I would recommend this hotel to anybody going to paris.

Reviews.Title: “A decent option in Paris, but watch out for booking policies”
Reviews.Author: SFVoyager
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with this hotel, and may return, but this is not the place to book if your plans change. It's nothing exciting - the area is a bit boring, and the hotel is nothing to write home about, but i've stayed at numerous places in Paris, and found this to be ok value for money. It's a very short walk to the metro Argentine, which is on line 1, so it makes getting to anywhere else in the city very easy, normally with only one connection, if not directly. the hotel is clean and up to date, having been recently refurbished. it probably won't win any design awards, but it's not the tired decor (floral bedspread, worn carpeting) you may find in some other places at the sub 200 EUR level ( i booked through hotels.com, and my price ranged from $207 to $390, depending on the night). the reception was generally friendly and helpful, although unless you book directly through them, they are not very helpful on the billing side. for example, they didn't tell me that if i checked out early, i would not get a refund for the night i didn't stay. since i booked through hotels.com, i had thought that i wouldn't be locked into anything, but after the fact, i noticed that the fine print did note that the hotel would charge you 1 night if you didn't cancel at least 5 days in advance, and there would be no refunds for early checkouts. no mention of the penalty for early checkout was mentioned when, at checkin, i mentioned this might be a possibility. all she said was "ok, let us know". to be honest, if their policies are going to be restrictive like that, they should let you know if they know it will impact you. this is what might prevent me from booking this hotel in the future - as a business traveler, i need flexibility in my schedule, and the hotel is not cheap enough to put up with annoyingly restrictive policies, and a staff that wash their hands of any booking made not directly with them.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: iannaa
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Pergolese and were very satisfied. The rooms are nice, clean and reasonably sized for city hotel rooms. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast buffet offered scrambled eggs, sausages, jambon, cheese, cereals, jams, patés, yoghurts, fruits and croissants. It is 5 minutes from Porte Maillot, where the Air France bus from CDG arrives and leaves and 5 minutes and you also find the RER for Versailles and 5 minutes from Argentine, Metro line 1. We booked it at a travel agency and had a special rate: 3 for 2 nights so the price was EUR 60 per person, which was a good deal. The Arc de Triomphe is just down the street, Grand Armée, and we climbed the 300 steps to its top at 10 p.m. without queuing at the ticket office, still paying EUR 8, but the view was gorgeous! There are also a very nice bakery and chocolatierie next to the hotel where we bought reasonably priced baguettes, quiches etc for our lunch pick-nicks.

Reviews.Title: “Take Nothing For Granted!”
Reviews.Author: jayryan007
Reviews.Content: Hi Booked nice weekend with my wife on web with Best Western Pergolese, Had confirmation via e-mail that hotel was booked and payment taken in FULL. when we arrived for relaxing break with only spending money CASH, were told that it was a common mistake on website and payment had not been taken! therfore we had to pay using spending money and wait to get help from home next day. The hotel room was supposed to have Air conditioning and although paris is quite cool in february the room above the kitchen gets really hot! (NO AIRCON AS ADVERTISED) also being above the kitchen you are treated to the cook preparing and CHOPPING his breakfasts. We would have just opened a window but a terraced patio area lead to our window, adjourned other buildings of unknown occupants. (WIFE WAS SCARED). Also last but not least the room advertised english T.V but was not working untill last day. Myself and my wife have never complained before but this really was a horrible un-relaxing break.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good location at all!”
Reviews.Author: Jessiek75
Reviews.Content: I honestly think the people who love this hotel have VERY low expectations when traveling. The hotel is NOT easy to find, not a single cab driver will be able to get you back there. The metro is not that close and walking around the area at night is a little scary. There is almost nothing to do within walking distance unless you consider a mile walking distance. The staff were horrible, they booked us 2 rooms for just one couple. Even after we showed them our confirmation for 1 room, they told us that they had already charged our card and there was nothing they could do. The room was ok, but the bathroom was terrible. The shower has a half glass wall that leaks and no shower curtain, so don't plan on putting any of your things in there if you don't want them soaked. The "king" size bed they advertised was just 2 twins pushed together under the same sheet. Not even a connector so of course we fell into the gap if we tried to snuggle. If you are a young (30's) couple this is not the hotel for you. Very quiet, boring part of town. The arc is close-ish, but still quite a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pergolese- Value for money”
Reviews.Author: mistyjt
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Pergolese for a few nights last weekend, Hotel was easy to find approx 5 mins walk from Argentine Metro stop, situated in a pleasant area of Paris, with little traffic noise from the nearby busy Champs Elysee Avenue. First stay in Paris and we were happy with our choice from many hotels on offer. Staff were pleasant and helpful and the rooms (we opted for the superior upgrade)and reception were clean with a modern feel. Not sure that it deserves a full 4 stars as the rooms are starting to look a little warn and on the small side, although I believe that this is a Paris standard. The bed was comfortable, although the bathroom was huge and modern but as we were in the front of the hotel our bathroom window was overlooking an office block, it was empty but with only a bit of net curtain and clear glass protecting you, could be worrying if the office starts being used!!! Didn't have the breakfasts on offer, found lots of local cafes instead along the main streets. Tip get a ticket for a few days that cover unlimited travel on the metros. We made the effort to speak French and this was appreciated, a weekend not enough to explore so will probably go back to Paris again, would we use the Pergolese again, probably not, but that was due to the long journey with a suitcase on the metro from the airport rather than the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tatonka88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our Honeymoon for 5 nights from June 5th 2006 in room 54. Whilst we are people who simply like to use the Hotel for a base while we fill our days exploring, we cant compliment it enough. The location is excellant in a quiet side street just off the Avenue Grand Armee. If you walk up this you are at the Arc de Triomphe in 5 minutes. It cost us 13 euros by taxi to get from Gare du Nord which is on the opposite side of the city and we did not arrive untill 23:20. Great value and a good early way to soak up the citys atmosphere. nice friendly welcome. Around the Hotel are the full selection of French shops including and excellant Boulangerie 20 yards away on the corner of Rue Duret. 100 yards Further down on Rue Duret is a Supermarket with lovely Wine and cheese so cheap you want to cry! Room 54 was a "superior" room but we got a great deal by booking directly on Best Westerns website. Whilst you expect Paris rooms to be "petit" this was perfectly adequate, situated at the end of a corridor with a your own small hall to further reduce any corridor noise (of which there was none). Big sash style windows opened out fully so we could sit at our table by the traditional iron grated window overlooking the peaceful central quadrangle. The room was serviced daily to a high standard and an iron and board brought and collected on request. Complimenary copies of the International Herald Tribune and Time magazine in the lobby were good. There are also comp City maps on the desk with 10% discount ticket for the department store Galleries Lafeyette so make sure you pick one up. The staff were most polite and helpful at all times. We had a mad notion to go to Disneyland Paris for a day and the Receptionist gave us spot on directions to get there by train. Metro station "argentine" is only 150 yards away and provides a dirct link on the yellow line to all the hustle and bustle, restaurants etc of Champs Elysees and Rue de Rivoli. On departure just one metro change at chatelet got us to gare du nord in 20 minutes for 1 euro 40 cents each. For a guaranteed clean, quiet and friendly base to explore Paris, surrounded by lots of " textbook French neighbourhood shops" this cant be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, efficient, stylish, value”
Reviews.Author: Carpinteria
Reviews.Content: Purportedly one of Paris's first "design hotels" fifteen years ago (of which there are now many), Hotel Pergolese continues to charm its guests and defy its age by being clean, charming, well-designed, and efficient. Due to a clever arrangement of multiple corridors and doorways, there is very little noise from the hallways or lift. While rooms with a garden view are the quietest, the small street which the others face endures very little traffic, and there is a sense of finding an oasis of calm only a few steps away from the hustle and bustle of a world class city. From its automatic doors to the designer-equipped bathrooms, this hotels exudes understated "grace, class, and charm" throughout. The air conditioning (individually controlled) worked well; the light fixtures and plumbing were all in terrific order, and there was plenty of closet space and an in-room safe large enough for my laptop. Internet service was available for too high of a price, but a free WiFi restaurant and cafe is only a block away To access the Internet, I simply sat on its steps when it was closed). Wonderfully close to the Air France bus stops (direct service to all airlines and terminals of Airport Charles De Gaulle), it's easy and inexpensive to reach from the airport. It's situated very close to Metro stop Argentine (Line 1 -- the handiest Metro line in all of Paris, as just about anywhere you wish to go rarely requires more than one change), it's a short walk to the Champs Elysees or Port Maillot. Check their direct booking site for incredibly low rates during many special periods. This is a very cozy and memorable 4 star hotel available for the price of a modest 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Pergolese!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On planning our next trip to Paris I had a look at the reviews of the Pergolese, just checking the high standards! My husband and I stayed at this hotel the same time as the 17th July 2005 reviewer (from Korea) our experience was VERY different, this is a charming hotel with equally charming staff. We travel to Paris at least once a year and were so impressed by the stylish Pergolese we are going to stay there again the same weekend this year and I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone. It has high standards of cleanliness and is convenient for the metro and good value!
